Package javelin.controller.challenge

Class ChallengeCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.challenge.ChallengeCalculator
  • public class ChallengeCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Determines a Monster.cr according to the rules of Upper Krust's work, which is repackaged with permission on the 'doc' directory. His reference is used to the best of my abilities but has been adapted in a few cases due to programming complexity and artificial intelligence efficiency. Such cases should be documented in Javadoc.
    See Also:
    CrFactor, Difficulty

    • Method Detail

      • calculatecr

        public static float calculatecr​(Monster m)
        See "challenging challenge ratings" source document (@ 'doc' folder), page 1: "HOW DO FACTORS WORK?". The silver rule isn't computed for at this stage the plan is not to use the PHB classes. This is intended more for human-readable CR, if you need to make calculation you might prefer calculaterawcr(Monster). Will also update Monster.cr.
        Parameters:
        m - Unit to rate.
        Returns:
        The calculated CR.

      • calculaterawcr

        public static float[] calculaterawcr​(Monster m)
        Unlike calculatecr(Monster) this method doesn't roundfraction(float) or translatecr(float), making it more suitable for more precise calculations.
        Parameters:
        m - Unit whose CR is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        An array where index 0 is the sum of all CR_FACTORS and 1 is the same after the golden rule has been applied.

      • ratesimpleability

        public float ratesimpleability​(int prerequisite,
                               int level,
                               float adjustment)
        To use with the Buy the Numbers system. Covers passive abilities, for others see #rateability(int, int, int, int). Note than when adding abilities to Javelin this way you should carefully consider the prerequisite tree, like having Barbarian Rage before Tireless Rage.
        Parameters:
        prerequisite - Usually 0 but when converting an ability from a prestige class this should be the minimum level required to enter that class.
        level - Level this ability is being taken from.
        adjustment - Usually 50% to 200% depending on the ability's usefulness.
        Returns:
        Challenge rating for this ability.

      • rateability

        public float rateability​(int minimumlevel,
                         int usesperday,
                         int startinglevel,
                         int casterlevel,
                         float adjustment)
        For use with the Buy the Numbers system. Encompasses activated, level-dependent and abilities with a limit on use per day (usually one of the two, at least). Note than when adding abilities to Javelin this way you should carefully consider the prerequisite tree, like having Barbarian Rage before Tireless Rage.
        Parameters:
        minimumlevel - The minimum level in which this ability can be accessed. If from a prestige class, add the prestige class level to the minimum level needed to enter that class.
        usesperday - How many times per day the ability can be used. 0 if the ability is not limited in uses per day.
        startinglevel - If the ability is enhanced by leveling up this is the starting levle it operates on. 0 otherwise. If the class is a prestige class this is the pure prestige class level (not added to minimumlevel).
        casterlevel - The current level this ability is operating on. 0 if not dependent upon level. If the class is a prestige class this is the pure prestige class level (not added to minimumlevel).
        adjustment - Usually 100 to 200% depending on the ability's usefulness.
        Returns:
        Challenge rating.

      • ratespelllikeability

        public static float ratespelllikeability​(int spelllevel,
                                         int casterlevel)
        I'm not sure if it's a typo or on purpose but .001 seems to be too low a factor, I'm using .01

      • ratespelllikeability

        public static float ratespelllikeability​(int spelllevel)
        Returns:
        challenge rating factor for the given spell level cast at the minimum possible caster level.

      • ratetouchspellconvertedtoray

        public static float ratetouchspellconvertedtoray​(int spelllevel)
        Same as ratespelllikeability(int) but to be used in case a touch spell is being used as a ray spell instead.

      • updatecr

        public static void updatecr​(java.util.ArrayList<Combatant> update)
        Parameters:
        update - Updates Monster.cr for each unit in this list.
